abstract: Georgia municipal judge Richard A Diment addressees video of him threatening to jail traffic offenders who couldn't pay fines; claims threat, never carried out, is necessary tactic meant to pressure defendants into paying or determining whether they can; question of ability-to-pay is still controversial despite 1983 Supreme Court ruling prohibiting jailing of defendants too poor to pay.
lead_paragraph: A surreptitious recording made in a Georgia courtroom touches on a relatively unexamined question in the legal system, at a time when fine-collection strategies are under increasing scrutiny.

headline.main: Court Conundrum: Offenders Who Can’t Pay, or Won’t
headline.print_headline: Deciding Who Can’t Pay in Court, and Who Just Won’t
